definitions.definition: To emit light as if heated .
examples: The fire was still glowing after ten hours.
Iron glows red hot when heated to near its melting point.
After their workout, the gymnasts' faces were glowing red.
The zealots glowed with religious fervor.

definitions.definition: To gaze especially passionately at something.

examples: The new baby's room glows with bright, loving colors.

definitions.definition: To feel hot; to have a burning sensation, as of the skin, from friction, exercise, etc.; to burn.
To be related to or part of an (chiefly online ) undercover sting operation , especially by American federal agencies .
to expose someone to the authorities.
to create a threatening online post that may involve violence, and look suspicious enough to attract a police investigation.

main_definition: To emit light as if heated .
secondary_definitions: To gaze especially passionately at something.
( transitive ) To make hot; to flush.
( intransitive ) To feel hot; to have a burning sensation, as of the skin, from friction, exercise, etc.; to burn.
( intransitive , Internet slang ) To be related to or part of an (chiefly online ) undercover sting operation , especially by American federal agencies .
( Internet slang , alt-right ) to expose someone to the authorities.
( Internet slang , alt-right ) to create a threatening online post that may involve violence, and look suspicious enough to attract a police investigation.
